question: Who among the following Rashtrakuta ruler was known as the 'Ashoka of South' ?
explanation:
Amoghvarsha I was known for his religious temperament, his interest in the fine arts and literature and his peace-loving nature. By inspiring from his peace-loving nature, historian Panchamukhi has compared Amoghvarsha I to the legendary emperor Ashoka and gave him the
honorific \"Ashoka of the South\".
